title: Half Moon
description: Balancing, Core, Standing Primary body parts engaged Abs, Glutes & Hip Flexors, Hamstrings, Obliques, Quadriceps Strengthens glutes, thighs and core Improves balance and coordination, relieves stress How to perform Half Moon Begin standing. Step your feet several feet apart. Turn your right toes 90 degrees to the right. Bend your right knee with an exhale and lean your torso to the right. Bring your right fingertips to the floor, about 12 inches in front of your right foot. Place your left hand on your left hip.
alignment_cues: Maintain steady breath throughout the pose
Keep proper alignment based on pose type
